original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa la med cing mi dmigs so //

translated: the feeling that arises from the union of the body, touch, and body-consciousness,

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: and the feeling that arises from the union of the mind, mental phenomena, and mind-consciousness have no nature that arises from a combination.

original: sa'i khams la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //üîΩchu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par @473a *//
analyzed: sa'i khams la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do // chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par @473a *//
translated: The earth element has no nature that arises from a combination.

original: shes pa'i khams la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: shes pa'i khams la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element have no nature that arises from a combination.

original: ma rig pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: ma rig pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Ignorance has no nature that arises from a combination.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature of ignorance, volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature of the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThere is no intrinsic nature of inner emptiness.

original: nang stong pa nyid la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //üîΩphyi stong pa nyid la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The emptiness of external and internal phenomena has no essence that comes together and accumulates.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'du ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature has no essence that comes together and accumulates.

analyzed: do // gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transition to another state.

translated: Ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness are empty of inherent nature.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Eye contact is empty of intrinsic nature.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking-mind contact are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand and does not fall away.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the eye is empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature does not arise and does not pass away.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand and does not fall away.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus @480b te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus @480b te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the ear, the feeling that arises from contact with the nose, the feeling that arises from contact with the tongue, the feeling that arises from contact with the body, and the feeling that arises from contact with the mind are empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature does not arise and does not pass away.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which is neither produced nor destroyed does not change from the position of rest.

original: sa'i khams rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i khams rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The earth element is empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature is neither produced nor destroyed.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which is neither produced nor destroyed does not change from the position of rest.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature is neither produced nor destroyed.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which is neither produced nor destroyed does not change from the position of rest.

original: ma rig pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do; ;gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //üîΩ'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do; ;gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do // 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration. That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation.üîΩConditioned and unconditioned phenomena, the world of humans and gods, the world of animals and hungry ghosts, the world of hell beings, the world of humans and the world of gods are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //üîΩgang la skye ba med cing 'jig @481a *//
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do // gang la skye ba med cing 'jig @481a *//
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transformation.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The perfection of generosity is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.üîΩThe perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand and does not fall away.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are empty of an inherent nature.üîΩThat which is empty of an inherent nature does not arise and does not pass away.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do; ;gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do; ;gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand and does not fall away.

original: nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Inner emptiness is empty of an inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of an inherent nature does not arise and does not pass away.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which does not arise and does not pass away does not stand and does not fall away.

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is empty of intrinsic nature.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That which has no arising and no disintegration has no abiding and no transition to another state.

original: sangs @481b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: sangs @481b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature has no arising and no disintegration.

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa de la gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: What is not produced and does not cease does not change from the state of rest.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /

analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de gzugs ma yin no //
translated: that which is not produced is not form.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not the eyes.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not the ears, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de gzugs ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not form.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not sound, smell, taste, feeling, or dharmas.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced is not the consciousness of the eyes.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness, the tongue consciousness, the body consciousness, or the mind consciousness.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not eye contact.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, or mind contact.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: @482a *// gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
analyzed: @482a *// gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of nose-contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue-contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of body-contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus ta reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus ta reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ma yin no //
translated: or the feeling that arises from the condition of mind-contact.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the earth element,

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: not the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, or the consciousness element.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de ma rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de ma rig pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not ignorance,

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: That which is unconditioned is not form, not feeling, not perception, not formation, not consciousness, not name and form, not the six sense sources, not contact, not sensation, not craving, not grasping, not existence, not birth, not aging and death, not the perfection of giving, not the perfection of patience, not the perfection of diligence, not the perfection of concentration, not the perfection of wisdom, not the perfection of skillful means, not the perfection of aspiration, not the perfection of strength, and not the perfection of knowledge.

original: rga shi ma yin no //
analyzed: rga shi ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not form, nor is it consciousness, nor is it name-and-form, nor is it the six sense fields, nor is it contact, nor is it feeling, nor is it craving, nor is it appropriation, nor is it becoming, nor is it birth, nor is it old age and death.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the perfection of generosity.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de nang stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de nang stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @482b sum cu rtsa bdun ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos @482b sum cu rtsa bdun ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is unconditioned is not omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,

original: gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: when you say,

original: ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa /
translated: ‚ÄòWhy is it unconditioned?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras zhes zer ba ni /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de mngon par ma grub pa ste /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so //

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa'ang gzhan la /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan du yang dag par rjes su mi @483a *//

original: mthong ste / de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyas su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: mthong ste / de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyas su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, non-establishment and the bodhisattva, are not two, they are not divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-establishment, they do not see form.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, non-establishment and form, are not two, they are not divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness apart from nonproduction.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas‚Äînonproduction and consciousness‚Äîare not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see the eyes apart from nonproduction.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas‚Äînonproduction and the eyes‚Äîare not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see the ears, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind apart from nonproduction.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas‚Äînonproduction and the thinking mind‚Äîare not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see form.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unestablished and form, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos @483b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos @483b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / chos zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su bar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / chos zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su bar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unestablished and dharmas, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see the eye consciousness.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unestablished and the eye consciousness, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the ear-consciousness, the nose-consciousness, the tongue-consciousness, the body-consciousness, or the thinking-consciousness apart from non-production.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, i.e. non-production and the thinking-consciousness, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-production they do not see the eye-contact.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, i.e. non-production and eye-contact, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /üîΩde ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis byar med do //

translated: They do not see the feeling that arises from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, or thinking-mind contact.üîΩThey do not see the earth constituent.üîΩThey do not see the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness constituent.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi @484a *//
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par mig gi @484a *//
translated: They do not see the earth constituent element.üîΩThey do not see the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness constituent element.üîΩThey do not see the earth, water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness heap.

original: 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
translated: They do not see the causal condition of the sensation that arises from the contact of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the causal condition of the sensation that arises from the contact of the mental faculty.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unformed and the causal condition of the sensation that arises from the contact of the mental faculty, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the earth element apart from the unformed.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / sa'i khams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / sa'i khams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unformed and the earth element, are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-establishment, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are not seen.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called non-establishment and the consciousness element are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa @484b ma gtogs par ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa @484b ma gtogs par ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from non-establishment, ignorance is not seen.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called non-establishment and ignorance are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: They do not see conditioning, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth,

original: rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or aging and death apart from non-arising.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rga shi zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rga shi zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called non-arising and aging and death are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the perfection of generosity apart from non-arising.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called non-arising and the perfection of generosity are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from what has not come into being, they do not see the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, what has not come into being and the perfection of wisdom‚Äîthese dharmas are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /üîΩde ltar na mngon @485a *//
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste / de ltar na mngon @485a *//
translated: Apart from what has not come into being, they do not see inner emptiness,

original: par ma grub pa dang / nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: par ma grub pa dang / nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, what has not come into being and inner emptiness‚Äîthese dharmas are not two, nor are they divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, they do not see the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called the unproduced and the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities are not two, they are not divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unproduced, they do not see the applications of mindfulness.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas called the unproduced and the applications of mindfulness are not two, they are not divided.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

translated: He does not see the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, or the noble eightfold path apart from nonproduction.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam ma gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam ma gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: Apart from nonproduction, he does not see the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete conquerings, the applications of mindfulness, the perfect efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, or the noble eightfold path.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par @485b shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par @485b shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: They do not see emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness; they do not see the meditative stabilizations, dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, tathƒÅgata powers, or fearlessnesses; they do not see the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do //

translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, and noble eightfold path are not apprehended, not taken up, not dwelled in,

original: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do //

analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: At that time, they do not apprehend, do not take up, do not settle down on, do not consider as ‚Äòmine,‚Äô and do not become emotionally involved with the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness,üîΩsignlessness,

translated: They do not apprehend, do not take up, do not settle down on, do not consider as ‚Äòmine,‚Äô and do not become emotionally involved with the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la 'dogs par mi bgyid do //

translated: further, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthey do not apprehend, do not take up, do not settle down on, and do not settle down on any of the gateways to the absorptions and dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s as real.

translated: He does not see the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.
